TEST.0.title: 2023 North Carolina State Division C
TEST.0.customHeader:
Names of participants: (Please print neatly)

 
 
 
School Name:

Warning: Do not open this packet until given permission to do so.     Note: There are useful notes after this page.

CIPHER.363.cipherString: Research is an endless loop of failures interspersed with occasional profound discoveries.
CIPHER.363.question: The following quote by Steven Magee has been encoded as an Aristocrat.  What does it decode to?

CIPHER.364.question: Solving this cryptarithm gives you the values to decode the values 98671 42350. What does it decode to?

CIPHER.382.cipherString: The only limit to our realization of tomorrow will be our doubts of today.
CIPHER.382.question: The following quote by Franklin Delano Roosevelt has been encoded with the Porta Cipher using a very common word for the key. The deciphered text ends with DAY.

CIPHER.377.cipherString: Por supuesto que hay aprendizaje sin enseñar. Es comúnmente referido por otro nombre: ciencia.
CIPHER.377.question: An observation has been translated into Spanish and encoded as an Aristocrat using a K1 English keyword.  What was encoded?
CIPHER.377.translation: Of course there is learning without teaching. It's just commonly referred to by another name: science.

CIPHER.366.cipherString: An artist is his own fault.
CIPHER.366.question: Using a keyword of BOLD, encode the following quote from John O’Hara.

CIPHER.372.cipherString: The power of knowledge is so great and forceful, if only we knew.
CIPHER.372.question: A quote from Norhafsah Hamid has been encoded using the Fractionated Morse Cipher for you to decode. You are told that the quote ends with KNEW.

CIPHER.365.cipherString: Each person deserves a day away in which no problems are confronted, no solutions searched for.
CIPHER.365.question: Maya Angelou offers an observation that has been encoded as an Aristocrat.  What does it decode to?

CIPHER.380.cipherString: Happiness consists not in having much, but in being content with little.
CIPHER.380.question: A quote by Marguerite Gardiner has been encoded using the Rail Fence Cipher for you to decode. You are told that 5 rails were used to encode it.

CIPHER.367.cipherString: Do not waste your days. Be one of those people who accomplish more in a week than others do in a year!
CIPHER.367.question: A quote by Catherine Pulsifer has been encoded using an Aristocrat Cipher with a K3 keyword.  What was the keyword used to encode the cipher?

CIPHER.370.cipherString: No great discovery was ever made without a bold guess.
CIPHER.370.question: Someone passed you a piece of paper with this Baconian encoded phrase of a quote by Sir Isaac Newton on it.  What does it decode to?

CIPHER.385.cipherString: Sometimes you've got to be able to listen to yourself and be okay with no one else understanding.
CIPHER.385.question: The following observation by Christopher Barzak has been encoded as an Aristocrat using a K1 keyword.  What does it decode to?

CIPHER.387.cipherString: Mirrors should think longer before they reflect.
CIPHER.387.question: A quote by Jean Cocteau has been encoded using the Pollux Cipher for you to decode. You are told that 1=●, 3=–, 5=×, 7=●, 9=×

CIPHER.373.cipherString: Too thinsg pre vent ewe from bee comin uh suces: dwelling in teh past with reegret, and folowing uthers blindly.
CIPHER.373.question: Your friend who can't spell or type very well is trying to offer you some advice which has then been encoded as an Aristocrat using a K1 alphabet.  What did they actually type in?

CIPHER.386.cipherString: Always remember that you are absolutely unique. Just like everyone else.
CIPHER.386.question: The following quote by Margaret Mead needs to be decoded with the Porta Cipher with a keyword of TWIN

CIPHER.383.cipherString: A mediocre idea that generates enthusiasm will go further than a great idea that inspires no one.
CIPHER.383.question: The following quote by Mary Kay Ash has been encoded using a K1 Key Phrase.  What was the Key Phrase used to encode it?

CIPHER.379.question: The following cryptarithm provides the key to decoding the values 364289 25 0175.  What does it decode to?

CIPHER.375.cipherString: The person born with a talent they are meant to use will find their greatest happiness in using it.
CIPHER.375.question: The following quote by Johann Wolfgang von Goethe has been encoded as an Aristocrat using a K1 keyword.  What was the keyword used to encode the quote?

CIPHER.378.cipherString: What is a rebel? A man who says no.
CIPHER.378.question: Decode the following quote from Albert Camus which has been encoded as a 3x3 Hill Cipher using a keyword of INNOVATOR.

CIPHER.368.cipherString: Good advice for anyone wanting to make an impact with a product, a service or even a message is to differentiate yourself.
CIPHER.368.question: The following Patristocrat is a quote by Donny Ingram which has been encoded using a K1 alphabet.  What does it decode to?

CIPHER.384.cipherString: What is not started today is never finished tomorrow.
CIPHER.384.question: The following symbols are a Baconian cipher of a quote by Johann Wolfgang von Goethe.  What do they decode to?

CIPHER.369.cipherString: What is a horses favorite sport? Stable Tennis.
CIPHER.369.question: A curious question has been encoded using the Morbit Cipher for you to decode. You are told that the quote has FAV in it corresponding to the encoded text 9757916.

CIPHER.371.cipherString: Whatever else astronomy may or may not be who can doubt it to be the most beautiful of the sciences?
CIPHER.371.question: The following quote by Isaac Asimov has been encoded as an Aristocrat using a K2 keyword.  What did he say?

CIPHER.376.cipherString: I used some magic to make some fog laugh. It was mist tickle.
CIPHER.376.question: The following strange headlines encode a quote by Aeschylus using a Baconian cipher. You are told that the deciphered text starts with IUSE.

CIPHER.381.cipherString: Science is the human endeavor to elevate the self and the society from the darkness of ignorance into the light of wisdom.
CIPHER.381.question: The following quote by Abhijit Naskar has been encoded as a Patristocrat using a K1 keyword.  What did they say?

CIPHER.374.cipherString: I do not fear computers. I fear the lack of them.
CIPHER.374.question: A quote by Isaac Asimov has been encoded using the Morbit Cipher for you to decode. You are told that 1=–×, 3=––, 5=●×, 7=××, 9=×●

CIPHER.388.question: Solve this cryptarithm and use the mappings to decode the values 906238 1475.  What do they decode to?

CIPHER.389.cipherString: Un hombre fue declarado culpable de abusar de las comas. El juez le advirtió que esperara una sentencia muy larga.
CIPHER.389.question: A joke has been translated into Spanish and encoded using the Aristocrat Cipher with a K1 alphabet for you to decode. What was the Spanish translation?
CIPHER.389.translation: A man was found guilty of overusing commas. The judge warned him to expect a really long sentence.

CIPHER.390.question: Decode this quote from William Shakespeare which has been encoded using a keyword of FOIL

CIPHER.391.cipherString: Speak softly and carry big cookie. Big enough to share with a good friend.
CIPHER.391.question: Solve this Railfence cipher of a quote by a famous Sesame Street character in which the letters PEAK appears.  It has been encoded with an offset of 0 using anywhere from 2 to 6 rails.

CIPHER.392.cipherString: On the other hand, you have different fingers.
CIPHER.392.question: A quote by Steven Wright has been encoded using the Morbit Cipher for you to decode. You are told that 1=×–, 2=–×, 3=––, 4=●–

CIPHER.436.cipherString: What do you have to do to have a party in space? You have to Planet.
CIPHER.436.question: Something your dad might say has been encoded using the Fractionated Morse Cipher for you to decode. You are told that the quote starts with WHAT DO.
